h1: How Many Calories in a Slice of Cheesecake?
assumptions: Standard New York-style cheesecake slice (1/8 of 9-inch cake, ~100 g), with graham cracker crust, cream cheese filling, baked, no toppings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, portion size, brand, crust type, and added toppings. Check labels or recipes for accuracy.

quick_answer.text: A typical slice of cheesecake contains about 350 calories, mostly from fat and carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a slice of cheesecake?
faqs.a: Approximately 350 calories for a standard slice.

faqs.q: What's the fat content in cheesecake per slice?
faqs.a: About 24 g total fat, including 12 g saturated fat.

faqs.q: Does cheesecake have a lot of sugar?
faqs.a: Yes, around 20 g of sugars per slice from the filling and crust.

faqs.q: How does portion size affect calories in cheesecake?
faqs.a: A full slice is ~350 kcal; half a slice is about 175 kcal, but varies by cut.
Yes, low-fat or no-bake versions can reduce calories to 200-250 per slice.
